Dear shepherd, I hope you'll excuse</br>The simple reproof I did give,</br>And altho' very weak is my Muse,</br>I'll wear the dear wreath while I live.
Thy friendship!  how sweet the reward,</br>How soothing that sound is to me!</br>For surely the musical BARD</br>Has breathed his soul into thee.
Suspicion's green eye I disdain;</br>With thee I could pleasantly stray;</br>We'd mourn the poetical swain,</br>And pour out our tears on his clay.
How well did young CORYDON know</br>These virtuous friendships to prize;</br>Nor car'd he what malice did flow</br>From their tongues, or from Argus's eyes.
'Tis the virtuous soul I admire,</br>And none can these feelings reprove;</br>When free from all earthly desire,</br>'Tis that alone I call love.
May health and long life crown thy days,</br>Soft slumbers attend on thy nights:</br>May thy dreams (sleeping fancy displays)</br>Be fill'd with unsully'd delights!
Young CORYDON'S friends are so dear,</br>Oh!  how shall I bid you adieu?</br>It must be for ever, I fear;</br>May heav'n be propitious to you!</br>
